description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
number of experiment from publication
year the data point was obtained
month the data point was obtained
day of the month the data point was obtained
name of the participant
age provided by author in data file
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical
variable referring to the task presented to the participants –string/ cane/ table tasks
variable referring to whether the participant chose the correct tool to retrieve the rewards

variable referring to the tool set they experienced on each trial. For the string and table condition there were 3 different sets. For the cane condition there was only one set. Each set was comprised of three tools consisting of two unsuitable and one suitable tool for each task
code for the tool(s) they transported from their initial location to the task location (codes a b or c for each of the tools within a set; for a combination of tools codes are summed (eg a+b))
variable referring to the specific tools they transported
code for the tool they used in the task location
variable referring to the specific tool they used
another individual present but not participating – can be an infant or in rare cases an adult
notes by the author to highlight exceptions
